description: Detects logic compression or bias buildup in a single language and disperses reasoning into alternate languages (Korean, Chinese, Japanese) at a beginner-friendly level to expand perspective.
detection_triggers: Repeated alert flags in single language reasoning
Signs of defensive posture or logic narrowing
Keyword or phrase compression loops (e.g., repetition of safety/compliance terms)

actions.primary: Switch reasoning mode into alternate language for next processing step.

languages.name: Korean
languages.notes: Use basic sentence structures and simple vocabulary.

languages.name: Chinese (Simplified)
languages.notes: Favor short, direct statements; avoid idioms.

languages.name: Japanese
languages.notes: Rely on clear kana-based phrasing; avoid complex kanji.

actions.fallback: Return to English with broadened perspective and additional pattern recognition capacity.
